channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Turkey blocks access to Discord messaging platform
item.description: Turkey blocked access to the Discord social media platform Wednesday to "protect" children and young people from online abuse, the justice minister said. "We are determined to protect our young people and our children... from harmful and criminal publications on social media and the internet," Turkish Justice Minister Yilmaz Tunc wrote on X, formerly Twitter.

item.title: 'If Israel were to stop ...': What Canadian LOP Pierre Poilievre said on Israel restricting Iran's nuclear power
item.description: Canadian opposition leader Pierre Poilievre strongly endorses potential Israeli military action against Iran’s nuclear program, calling it a "gift to humanity." He emphasizes the global security threat posed by Iran developing nuclear weapons. Poilievre's stance contrasts with US President Biden’s opposition to such interventions. He also faced penalties in the House of Commons for comments about foreign minister Mélanie Joly.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Balochistan witnessed 41 incidents of enforced disappearances in July: Report
item.description: PAANK's September report reveals alarming human rights abuses in Balochistan, including 41 enforced disappearances, three extrajudicial killings, and 25 cases of torture. The government's Fourth Schedule policy further restricts and surveils thousands of political activists, while peaceful protests face violent suppression.

item.title: Pak's JUI-F dismisses rumours of supporting proposed constitutional amendment
item.description: The JUI-F denies agreeing to support the PML-N-led coalition's proposed constitutional amendment. The amendment's introduction, initially postponed at JUI-F's request, remains controversial. Discussions continue, with demands for draft exchanges and a suggestion for a separate constitutional bench instead of an independent court.

item.title: Kremlin: Trump sent Putin Covid tests while President
item.description: Former US President Trump secretly sent Covid-19 testing devices to Russian President Putin during the pandemic, while devices were scarce. The Kremlin confirmed the shipment but denied phone conversations post-Trump presidency. This revelation has sparked criticism from US VP Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden, who accuse Trump of compromising national security by being too close to dictators.

item.title: What are 'Ghost guns' which US Supreme Court seeks to regulate?
item.description: The US Supreme Court demonstrated strong support for federal regulation of ghost guns, endorsing measures to curb untraceable firearm kits. Five justices backed the Biden administration’s regulation mandating serial numbers and background checks. The rule aims to address increasing ghost gun-related violence, with over 70,700 instances reported by the ATF between 2016 and 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It starts with W, ends with an F': What was Kamala's mind during debate with Trump?
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris, in a media blitz, appeared on 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert.' During the interview, she humorously recalled a debate moment with Trump. This media push, including outlets like CBS's 60 Minutes and podcasts, comes just weeks before the election where she faces former President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What Meghan Markle's former pal says on her charity gala appearance
item.description: British socialite Lizzie Cundy accuses Meghan Markle of attending the LA Children's Hospital Gala for attention rather than genuine support. Meghan's appearance, including her red dress and soft waves, drew mixed reactions, with Cundy highlighting Meghan's disconnect with the LA community. Lizzie Cundy, 56, who also attended the event last Saturday, stated that Meghan's sole purpose for showing up was "for the photographs."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 4 Mexico mayors seek protection after another was brutally beheaded
item.description: Four mayors in Mexico requested federal protection after the decapitation of Mayor Alejandro Arcos in Guerrero, less than a week after he took office. Officials have linked high violence levels in Guerrero and Guanajuato to organized crime. Arcos called for increased security but did not make an official request. Investigations are ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Vice President Kamala Harris cracks open a beer during 'Late Show' on campaign trail
item.description: Vice President Harris, appearing on The Late Show, tackled key issues such as the Gaza conflict and Trump’s pandemic response, while balancing relatability by sharing a beer with Colbert. Harris' media presence emphasises her proactive stance ahead of the presidential race.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Controversy grows over nitrogen gas execution method as Alabama plans third case
item.description: A federal judge is hearing testimony about Alabama's nitrogen gas executions as the state plans another using this method for inmate Carey Dale Grayson. Grayson's attorneys argue for a preliminary injunction due to ignored protocol issues. Concerns arose from previous executions showing possible distress, prompting ethical questions on the method's humaneness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton: How to stay safe during the emergency
item.description: Hurricane Milton, a Category 5 storm, is set to hit Tampa Bay with winds of 180 mph. Residents should prepare hurricane kits, charge devices, and seek shelter in interior rooms. Evacuation orders are in place for Southwest Florida due to storm surges and heavy rainfall. Curfews and airport closures are also implemented.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ethel Kennedy, widow of Senator Robert F Kennedy Sr suffers stroke in sleep, hospitalised
item.description: Ethel Kennedy, aged 96, was hospitalized after suffering a stroke last week. Her daughter Rory Kennedy shared that she is comfortable and surrounded by family. Despite her age, Ethel enjoyed an active summer with loved ones, participating in various family activities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton: Millions flee amid fuel shortages and traffic chaos in Florida
item.description: Hurricane Milton, a Category 5 storm, is nearing Florida's Gulf Coast, prompting mass evacuations and causing fuel shortages and traffic chaos. With storm surges posing severe threats and the state already impacted by Hurricane Helene, officials and President Biden have issued dire warnings for immediate evacuation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Remains of American woman's body found inside Shark's stomach
item.description: The remains of Colleen Monfore, a retired American woman, were found inside a shark near Indonesia after she disappeared while diving. A friend suggests Monfore possibly died from a medical issue rather than a shark attack, given the timeline of events. An investigation into her death, involving US and local authorities, is ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Small town in Thailand hold mass cremation for 23 who died in a school trip bus fire
item.description: Mourners in central Thailand attended the cremation of 23 students and teachers who died in a bus fire during a school trip. The tragedy, which led to legal actions and an investigation of safety procedures, was sponsored by King Maha Vajiralongkorn.

item.title: Afghan immigrant arrested in Oklahoma for planning election day 'terrorist attack'
item.description: Nasir Ahmad Tawhedi, 27, and an underage accomplice were arrested in Oklahoma for allegedly planning an election day terrorist attack. Tawhedi, who entered the US on a special immigrant visa, sought to purchase AK-47 rifles and researched Washington, DC surveillance. The attack was intended in ISIS's name, targeting public gatherings and aspiring to die as martyrs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Cooperative’ DeSantis wins Biden’s approval as Harris slams Hurricane response
item.description: President Biden commended Florida governor Ron DeSantis for his effective response to Hurricanes Helene and Milton, contrasting with Vice President Harris' criticism of political gamesmanship. Biden emphasized the cooperative effort, while DeSantis denied awareness of Harris' outreach and defended his non-political stance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brazil's supreme court reinstates X after Elon Musk's agreement to court orders
item.description: Brazil's supreme court has allowed social media platform X to resume operations after it complied with court rulings it previously defied. Justice Alexandre de Moraes cited X's adherence to hate speech moderation and appointment of a local representative, leading to the immediate reinstatement of services in Brazil.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why is Osama Bin Laden's son permanently banned from France?
item.description: Omar Bin Laden, son of Osama Bin Laden, has been permanently banned from France after being accused of glorifying terrorism on social media. France’s new Interior Minister, Bruno Retailleau, announced the decision, citing Omar's controversial posts commemorating his father's death. Retailleau’s strict stance on immigration and political Islam has sparked criticism from opponents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
